page.title: 07The Dee Abstraction Scheme.
page.content: Bretton Water Treatment works started in 1968 by central Flintshire Water Board because demands increased for water in North East Wales in the late 1960's. A survey in 1964 and 1965 revealed that substantial treatment works were required to improve distribution systems which had been allowed to deteriorate in years prior to development of water sources The demand of the area was 3.21 million gallons per day no less than 2.14 million gallons the bulk of which was supplied from Wirral Water Boards Alwen aqueduct. Construction of Bretton works began in 1972 to take extra water from the Dee but suffered delays in 1973 and disputes in 1974.
